data.question: What is the DOI of the article discussing the ferroelectric and ferrimagnetic properties of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
Which institution is associated with the corresponding author of the study on [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: Institute for Molecular Science, Myodaiji, Okazaki 444-8585, Japan

data.question: What are the ferroelectric and ferrimagnetic transition temperatures reported for [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: Ferroelectric transition at 165 K and ferrimagnetic transition at 8.5 K.

data.question: How was [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) synthesized according to the article?
data.answer: [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) crystals were obtained by keeping [Mn3(HCOO)6] crystals in ethanol vapor for several days.

data.question: What is the significance of the guest ethanol molecules in the structure of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: The guest ethanol molecules contribute to the ferroelectric properties of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH), as indicated by the ferroelectric transition at 165 K.

data.question: What method was used to confirm the magnetic transition of Mn2+ spin system in [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: Magnetic measurements were performed by SQUID magnetometer at 2−300 K to confirm the ferrimagnetic transition at 8.5 K.

data.question: What does the presence of a sharp peak at 165 K in the dielectric measurements of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) indicate?
data.answer: The sharp peak at 165 K in the dielectric measurements indicates a ferroelectric transition.

data.question: Why was single crystal used in dielectric experiments for [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: Single crystals were used because crystalline powder samples showed anomalously high εr around room temperature, which did not occur with single crystals.

data.question: How does the structure of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) change with temperature according to the article?
data.answer: The structure of the host lattice changes very little with temperature, but the arrangement of guest ethanol molecules changes significantly between 90 and 190 K.

data.question: What role do the Mn2+ ions play in the properties of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: The Mn2+ ions are responsible for the magnetic properties of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH), contributing to its ferrimagnetic transition at 8.5 K.

data.question: What does the weight loss observed in the TGA measurement of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) indicate?
data.answer: The observed 9.7% weight loss corresponds to the calculated weight loss of one ethanol molecule, indicating the presence of ethanol in the crystal structure.

data.question: What is the significance of the hysteresis loop observed just below the ferroelectric transition temperature in [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: The hysteresis loop indicates a phase transition, supporting the ferroelectric properties of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH).

data.question: Is [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) considered the first ferroelectric, porous molecular crystal according to the article?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the article claim that the ferroelectric properties of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) are mainly due to the Mn2+ ions?
data.answer: False

data.question: According to the article, does the deuteration of ethanol affect the dielectric behavior of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH)?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the ferrimagnetic transition temperature of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) higher than that of [Mn3(HCOO)6](H2O)(CH3OH)?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the article suggest that the ferroelectric and ferrimagnetic orders in [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) do not coexist below 8.5 K?
data.answer: False

data.question: According to the article, is the guest-free [Mn3(HCOO)6] crystal ferroelectric?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the space group of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) changed from P21/n below the ferroelectric transition temperature according to the article?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the article indicate that the magnetic properties of [Mn3(HCOO)6](C2H5OH) are derived from the guest ethanol molecules?
data.answer: False
